name: Dade's conjecture
rephrased: When a finite group has a trivial p-core, the number of irreducible characters in a p-block with positive defect can be counted using characters from blocks of its p-local subgroups.
implication_form: If a finite group G has trivial p-core and B is a p-block of G with positive defect, then the number of irreducible characters in B is less than or equal to the sum over certain p-local subgroups H of the number of irreducible characters in blocks of H that are 'Dade correspondent' to B.
